nodes.text: Drone-Blaster was one of the many games that Torra Doza had. It involved holographic images of remotes flying around a space, and the player had to shoot the images with a toy blaster in order to obtain points and win.

The holograms from Torra Doza's Drone-Blaster employed the same style of training remotes used by Luke Skywalker in the 1977 film Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope, the first installment of the Star Wars original trilogy.
